Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Anti-Dumping Pricing of Eggs in Interprovincial Trade

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Canadian Egg Anti-dumping Pricing Regulations.

Definition.Text: egg means the egg of a hen; (oeuf)
hen means a hen of any class of the domestic chicken belonging to the species Gallus Domesticus; (poule)

marketing in relation to eggs, means selling and offering for sale and buying, pricing, assembling, packing, processing, transporting, storing and reselling, whether in whole or in processed form. (commercialisation)

Section.Text: No person shall market eggs in a province other than the province in which the eggs are produced at a price that is less than the aggregate of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the price charged at or about the same time for eggs of an equivalent variety, class or grade in the province or other geographical area in which the eggs are produced; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any reasonable transportation charges therefor to the place where such eggs are marketed and that are incurred by the person marketing the eggs.
